snippet: While race is woven into the background of the Florida trial of a man who killed a black teenager, the case appears likely to focus more on the mechanics of the state’s self-defense laws and how juries apply them.
abstract: First-degree murder trial of Michael D Dunn begins in Jacksonville, Fla; white software developer says he killed black teenager Jordan Davis in self-defense in Nov 2012 after confrontation over loud music; while race is woven into background of trial, case appears likely to focus more on the mechanics of Florida’s self-defense laws and how juries apply them.
lead_paragraph: While race is woven into the background of the Florida trial of a man who killed a black teenager, the case appears likely to focus more on the mechanics of the state’s self-defense laws and how juries apply them.

headline.main: Trial Brings New Scrutiny of Self-Defense Laws
headline.print_headline: Trial Brings New Scrutiny of Self-Defense Laws
